Valentine: Ortiz 'decided not to play anymore' after trade

In an interview with Bob Costas, ex-Sox manager Bobby Valentine claimed David Ortiz halted his comeback from an injury after the team traded three stars. (Globe)

Kennedy cousin proclaims innocence

Michael Skakel, serving 20 years to life for the fatal 1975 beating of Martha Moxley, said during a parole hearing he did not commit the crime. (AP, 10:24 a.m.)

Pictures: Shark attacks, sightings, facts

A number of shark sightings took place off Cape Cod this summer. Here is a collection of shark activity here and around the world, along with shark facts.

Poll: Warren leads Brown by five points

A WBUR survey released today has Elizabeth Warren at 48 percent and Brown at 43 percent, a five-point gap that exceeds the poll’s margin of error. (Globe, 7:47 a.m.)
  • Runway to Beltway: Brown's modeling days | Pictures

Kraft bid to rezone raising anxiety

Lingering anxieties about a gambling operation are complicating the Kraft Group's attempt to find a new use for the land across from Gillette Stadium. (Boston Globe)

List of drug firm customers grows

The FDA's updated list of customers that purchased products from the Framingham firm linked to a national meningitis outbreak now includes 215 in Mass. (Globe)

Tropical storm heads for Jamaica

Jamaicans hunkered down at home as Tropical Storm Sandy soaked the Caribbean island with steady rain Wednesday morning and forecasters said it was likely to rake the country as a hurricane.
